text: The St. Matthew Church was a church in Leipzig, Germany. It was built in 1488. At first, it was a Franciscan church. From 1699, it was a Lutheran church. It was known as the Neukirche (English: "New Church"). In 1867, a new congregation was created. They named the church Matth√§ikirche. It was destroyed in 1943 during the Second World War. title: St. Matthew, Leipzig
